page.title: 04 Local History
page.content: After the time of the Norman Conquest the manors of Whitstable and Seasalter were part of the possession of the Conqueror's half brother Odo Bishop of Bayeux. From the 16th to the 18th century the copperas industry flourished.On May 3rd 1830 the Canterbury to Whitstable railway opened and was the first steam drawn passenger train.On March 9th 1832 the harbour opened as the port of Canterbury.It was the 1st harbour to be served by railway.In 1837 the first steam boat to sail from England to Australia left Whitstable.It was called William IV. During the 18th and 19th century Whitstable was a centre for smugglers,divers and fishermen.In 1854 the first Sea Cadet Movement was founded here. In 1920 the first council houses in the world were built here.
